body:
Comment 2: 
Info.Objects is only useful for expressions that appeared in the checked package's
source, whereas a use case for Eval is new expressions.  A partial workaround is to
create a one-off package containing only the expression of interest, but this doesn't
handle unexported names.

It seems well within the domain of go/types to check expressions.  How about we upgrade
EvalNode to Config.CheckExpr?
